musicalLanguage.description: A hypnotic 6/8 blues from Kind of Blue that grooves like a slow waltz. Built on a G7 mixolydian foundation, the piece uses a rocking left-hand figure that never stops. The piano tremolo between two voicings creates the signature shimmering sound that Bill Evans made famous.
musicalLanguage.structure: 12-bar blues in 6/8. This excerpt: first 8 bars (I and IV chords)
keyMoments: Bar 1-4: G7 — the hypnotic rocking figure establishes the trance-like feel
Bar 5-6: C7/G — the IV chord. Same rocking motion, new harmony
Bar 7-8: Back to G7 — the groove never breaks, only the colors change
teachingGoals: 6/8 feel — two groups of three, like a slow waltz with blues flavor
Piano tremolo/rocking voicing technique between two shapes
Blues form adapted to 6/8 — same I-IV-V structure, different groove
styleTips: The left hand rocks gently — think of a boat on calm water
Do not accent beat 1 too hard — let the 6/8 flow evenly
Right hand melody is sparse and modal — leave lots of space

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: G7 — the rocking bass pattern: G-B-D repeating in eighth notes. Two groups of three in 6/8.

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: G7 continues. Right hand adds the b7 (F) — this is the blues note.

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: Melody peaks at G5 then descends. The groove stays hypnotic underneath.

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: Phrase ends on B4 with a rest. Silence is as important as sound.

measures.leftHand: C3:e E3:e G3:e C3:e E3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 — the IV chord! Left hand shifts the rocking pattern to C-E-G.

measures.leftHand: C3:e E3:e G3:e C3:e E3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: C7 continues. Bb is the 7th — dominant color over the IV chord.

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: Back to G7. Same voicings as bar 1. The groove comes home.

measures.leftHand: G2:e B2:e D3:e G2:e B2:e D3:e
measures.teachingNote: G7 settles. The melody disappears, leaving only the rocking bass.
